column2: This character does not hail from the Mushroom World.

This is an Ameboid. Originally existing in an alternate dimension, Ameboids are comprised of gel and possess no internal organs. Capable of division by mitosis, they can create up to five copies of themselves at once.
This is a Sea Anemone. Sea Anemones are native to underwater biomes and, to rule or function on land, must be in an acquatic enclosure.
This is an Angry Sun. Despite its name, it is not any sort of star. Rather, it is a flying being of living fire and energy, consumed with rage at all life besides itself.

This is a jumped up animal that somehow managed to gain or possess sentience. These creatures almost always have extradimensional counterparts in the so-called "Earth", where men are thought to have come from eons ago.
This is an Ankiron: a fiercely armed tortoise featuring massive artillery arrays on its shell.
This is an Anuboo, a mysterious dog-like spirit native to the Teehee Valley of the Beanbean Kingdom.

This is an Appleby. Applebies are creatures that live underground, only surfacing to plant and harvest fruit or defend themselves. As their name suggests, apples are their primary source of food, and they will surface to plant their own apple orchards, that they may acquire more apples.
This is an Attacky Sack. Attacky Sacks are beautifully colored, flying, intelligent, spherical carnivores with a fierce appetite.
This creature is some form of balloon or other latex-coated being capable of flight.

This is a Bandinero, native to the Shake Dimensions as well as the Mushroom World. Although Bandineroes are a type of Goom, they cannot produce fertile offspring with other Gooms and are thus considered a wholly separate species.

This is a scheming Bandit. Distinguished by their height and lack of a mask, Bandits are a type of Shy Guy possessing fantastic speed and, as their name implies, a tendancy to engage in all forms of theft. Hiearchies of Bandits are very common: Bandits possessing far higher criminal skills will wear different colors than the standard blue or red, which normally indicate pickpockets. The traditional leader of a pack or family of Bandits is a Big Bandit, which has the exclusive privilege of donning green robes. However, Bandit underlings are not afraid to abandon Big Bandits that show weakness. Bandits are generally not to be trusted.
This is a Barney Bubble. Barney Bubbles are slow moving, long-lived beinngs that shoot weaponized bubbles.
This is a Beaker. Beakers are quiet, pacifistic, spinning beings native to the Peaceful Woods, and once enslaved by Wario during his attempted conquest of what he deemed "Wario Woods".
This is a Beanish, a charasmatic humanoid and dominant species of the Beanbean Kingdom.
This is a bee. Bees are eusocial, collecting in hives and nests under a hiearchy of dependent drones and a queen. Bees, notably, always form a matriarchial society.
This is a Belome. Belomes are ancient, powerful canids found at the Land's End.

I just hope no one finds out who fed this GREAT, BIG, BERTHA Cheep Cheep some rocks, though. It's true what they say about the GREAT, BIG, BERTHA. I can shoot rocks farther with the GREAT, BIG, BERTHA'S help than with any of the normal Cheep Cheeps. That rock just goes and goes. One rock flew through a Yoshi chief's mansion window. I wish it had hit that Birdo. Stupid Birdo. I hate that Birdo.
This is some form of bivalve, be it is a clam, oyster, mussel, scallop, or other such creature.
This is a Blockhopper. Blockoppers are durable, jumping machines affixed inside brick blocks.
This is a Blockstepper. Blocksteppers are social block-shaped beings that almost always travel in groups.
This is a Blooper: an extremely intelligent, fast moving, floating jellyfish. They can breathe on land and on water and are capable of flight and extremely fast swimming.
This is a Blowhard. Blowhards are sentient, mechanical fans that normally nest in one location and rarely move. It is unknown who created them or for what purpose
This is a Blurker. Blurkers are puffy, squishy blocks that are immune to being stomped on.

This is a Blurp, also known as a Blurpfish. While very similar and closely related to Cheep Cheeps, they are not able to produce fertile offspring with Cheep Cheeps, and thus, are considered their own species.

This is a Bob-omb: a highly intelligent, sentient, powerful explosive device capable of detonating itself and operating artillery. Some Bob-ombs are capable of detonating themselves on a regular basis, while others are suicide bombers. Bob-ombs have their own endemic language that sound variations of "Vick" in rapid succession, but are universally capable of speaking the common language of the Mushroom World.

This is a Bombat. Bombats were engineered five thousand years ago to protect the ancient tomb of the human Pharaoh Poobah, who struck an evil deal with a wraith called Terrormisu to induce a great famine on his populace in exchange for an infinitely powerful Wishtone. Before the deal could be struck, Pharoah Poobah was instead betrayed by Terrormisu and entombed in his own palace for his sins. Bombats were set up in the tomb by Terrormisu using arcane black magic, bioengineering, and chemical warfare.

This is a Bombshell Koopa. Closely related to the Koopa Troopa and capable of breeding with other Koopas, Bombshell Koopas are quadripedal Koopa Troopas with black shells. They are hot-headed and short-tempered, and get their name from the fact that they will explode if too much pressure is applied at once on their shells.

As Dry Bones are to living Koopa Troopas, so too are Bony Beatles to living Buzzy Beatles. Also known as Dry Buzzy Beatles, these fully sentient, zombified remains haunt ruins, graveyards, and tombs across the Mushroom World. They retain their original personality, allegiance, and memories.

This is a Boo, the most common type of ghost in the Mushroom World. Boos are weak independently but can amass unmatched strength when congregated closely together. Boos exist on every continent and in every culture in the ubitiqous Ghost Houses and haunted mansions all across the planet. Weak Boos, called Boo Buddies, cannot look upon the living without freezing up in fear like their larger kin can. All Boos, regardless of location, are lead by the King Boo, a greedy, iron-fisted, absolute monarch of obsecene wealth and ambition.

Also called "Boo Blah", Booblahs are spirits which lie in wait to startle their prey, suddenly jumping out and screeching in order to disorient them for their attacks and consumption. Unlike many other types of ghosts, Booblahs are fully temporal and can be touched, or even consumed by creatures such as Yoshis.
This is a Boo Guy, the spirit form of a Shy Guy. They behave as Shy Guys do and wield few ghostly abilities, and retain their original personality, allegiance, and memories.
This is a Borp. Borps are little, sentient, bush-like creatures bearing flowers, native to Cavi Cape.

This is a Boss Bass- an adult, male Cheep Cheep nearing the end of its maximum lifespan. Its female equivalent is the BIG BERTHA. Boss Basses are among the fiercest fish in the sea, capable of eating creatures exceeding six feet in height in one gulp. Unlike sharks and other carniverous fish, Boss Basses openly seek out and attempt to devour prey on land. Boss Basses will brag about what they consumed to their friends and have, on rare occasions, even eaten Cheep Cheeps that are not their spawn. Firecely loyal to their mate and their spawn, Boss Basses are the nightmarish creatures that sailors tell their children about on a dark and stormy night. Most Cheep Cheeps do not live long enough to become Boss Basses or BIG BERTHAS.

This is a Bow Balloon. Bow Balloons form warrior castes and are expertly trained in all forms of archery. A Bow Balloon is a valuable asset if a Bullet Bill launcher, Tank, or other firearm is not at one's disposal.

This is a Bowser. Bowsers are an extremely rare, feared, prestigious type of Koopa denoted by their spiked shells, sheer size, and organization skills. They possess unmatched strength, can breathe fire, and are natural-born commanders of legions of armies. Bowsers possessing horns are considered destined to govern by all Koopas and enjoy their admiration. Wait, what's that? Yes, Bowsers are named after Bowser Koopa, King of Dark Land. King Bowser was the first, and only, creature of any type to ever unite the sporadic, diverse creatures of Dark Land. Due to this, Bowser's species become synonymous with fear, respect, and devotion to his troops. For Koopas of all stripes, to be a Bowser Koopa is to be blessed.
This is a Brock, the metallic, living brick-shaped entity native to Pi'illo Island and co-dominant with the Pi'illo race.

This is a Brolder. Brolders are massive rock entities that manuever by rolling. When under attack, they will retreat into their "shell" in order to withstand hits. Brolders can be picked up when they have withdrawn into themselves
This is a Broozer, an aggressive, punching spirit. Unlike many ghosts Broozers are completely temporal and thus can be touched..... which also means they can "touch" the living. Painfully.

This is a Bullet Bill. As their name suggests, Bullet Bills (which are not always male) are literally sentient, flying bullets capable of great speed. Bullet Bills can hover in the air and move very slowly under their own power, but in order to achieve maximum velocity and power, they must be launched from an artillery shell. The largest known Bullet Bill is the fearsome Bonzai Bill, which can plough through entire buildings at a time.
This is a Bully: a brutish, powerful, horned, spherical entity that got its name for its hateful, territorial mindset.
This is a Bumbleprod, a horned varient of the Spiny. While being closely related to the Spiny, Bumbleprods cannot produce fertile offspring with Spinies, meaning they are in fact a separate species.

This is a Burt. Burts are cheerful, clownish, social creatures whose main interest is frolicking and playing. For some reason, however, they are fiercely hated by Yoshis. Only giant Burts are a threat to most life.
Buzzes are advanced, sentient, mechanical bee sentries built for defense of strategic locations.

This is a Buzzy Beatle. Buzzy Beatles are a type of Koopa with an extremely thick shell, and are, in fact, not any form of beatle. Buzy Beatles are extraordinarily perceptive and impervious to being stepped on.
A Capnap is an armless, healthy, bleary creature normally found sleeping. When awake, they pose little threat.

This is a Cataquack, a flightless bird capable of throwing objects for yards, or directly upward for dozens of feet. Historically, they were used as living siege engines when Isle Delfino came under attack.

This is a Centipede. Centipedes are massive, biologically immortalm insect-like creatures consisting of sixteen segments plus their head. Absent knives, artillery, and explosives, no known natural attack, such as breathing fire, a Yoshi Egg or stomping, can harm them. They do not have one hundred legs.

This is a Chain Chomp. Chain Chomps are attack dogs in the Mushroom World and almost never possess any higher intelligence or speech. Normal Chain Chomps are encased in an exoskeleton of metal, but more ancient Chain Chomps of stone also exist. Chain Chomps hold no allegiance except a benevolent owner. For wicked masters, Chain Chomps are loyal only when they are not allowed to roam free. As their name suggests, a Chain Chomp, regardless of opinion of its master, is only an effective line of defense when bound to a stationary object. Chain Chomps that are mistreated or abused will always turn on their owners if unchained or released from a controlling spell.
This is a Charging Chuck, a type of burly Koopa known for its athleticism, charismatic teamwork, comraderie, and sportsmanship. Not all Charging Churcks are named Chuck, nor are they all male

This is a Cheep Cheep. Cheep Cheeps are a type of fish that spend the vast majority of their lives in a small, juvenile state. Cheep Cheeps that live extraordinarily long lives ultimately mature to Boss Basses if they are male, and BIG BERTHAS if they are female.
This is a Cherbil. Cherbils are bizzarely shaped, floating creatures consisting of chemicals that, when inhaled or ingested, induce immediate slumber.

This is a Choppah, a gentle insect capable of sustained, hovering, flight. Its method of flying is unique to all other known insects in that it roates its wings in full circles around its bodies, like its namesake's rotors.
This is a Chuckorok, a living stone that shoots other stones from its mouth. It is native to the Chucklehuck Woods.
